channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump rattled over story about his disparaging of war dead, and fearful it could hurt reelection chances
Retired general's scathing message to Trump: You're no patriot
item.description: Retired Maj. Gen. Paul Eaton explains his reaction to President Donald Trump's comments about the military to CNN's Brianna Keilar.

item.title: These three women stood up to Europe's longest-serving dictator. Here's what happened to them
item.description: Five weeks have passed since Belarus learned the results of its presidential election, in which the country's Central Election Commission announced that President Alexander Lukashenko, often described as Europe's last dictator, had won with 80.23% of the vote.

item.title: The UK says it is ready to break international law over Brexit
item.description: The UK is preparing legislation which will "break international law in a very specific and limited way," a cabinet minister has said in the House of Commons.

item.title: Navalny-linked volunteers fall ill after attack with unknown substance
item.description: At least three volunteers linked to Russian opposition figure Alexey Navalny's team were taken ill on Tuesday after an attack on their Novosibirsk office with an unknown substance, an opposition activist told CNN.

item.title: Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine could be ready for approval by mid-October -- but there are still 'unknowns'
BioNTech CEO: I consider this vaccine 'near perfect'
item.description: Ugur Sahin, CEO and co-founder of BioNTech, tells CNN's Fred Pleitgen that the U.S.-German cooperation of Pfizer and BioNTech could have a Covid-19 vaccine ready for regulatory approval by the middle of October.

item.title: Harris says she would trust vaccine under Trump if health officials OK it
Disney hit by backlash after thanking Xinjiang authorities in 'Mulan' credits
item.description: Disney has publicly thanked a Chinese government agency accused of human rights abuses in Xinjiang for its help in making "Mulan" â€” a revelation that has provoked a storm of criticism online.

item.title: Boeing discloses new flaw with 787 jet as problems mount
item.description: The problems at Boeing continue to mount. The company disclosed a new problem with the manufacturing of its 787 Dreamliner that will put a further crimp in its aircraft deliveries.

item.title: US Marine pardoned by Philippines for killing of transgender woman
item.description: A United States Marine convicted of killing a transgender woman in the Philippines in 2014 has been granted an "absolute pardon" by President Rodrigo Duterte in a case that sparked outrage over alleged preferential treatment given to American military personnel on assignment in the country.

item.title: China and India accuse each other of firing shots as border tensions escalate
item.description: China and India have accused each other's troops of firing warning shots during a confrontation Monday on their disputed border in the Himalayas, a marked escalation in tensions between the two nuclear powers.

item.title: Newly renovated Rose Garden under repair less than 3 weeks after unveiling
item.description: The newly renovated White House Rose Garden is under repair less than three weeks after it's official unveiling. The garden is experiencing "issues with water drainage" and "some minor complications with updated construction," a source with knowledge of the garden troubles told CNN. New sod is also being laid down.

item.title: Surfer dies after shark attack at popular Australia beach
item.description: An Australian man died after he was attacked by a shark on Tuesday at a popular surfing spot in Queensland, authorities say.

item.title: Lost German warship discovered on seabed 80 years after sinking
item.description: A German warship sunk by a torpedo during World War II has been found on the seabed off Norway, more than eight decades after it was attacked.

item.title: Novak Djokovic is 'in pain' after US Open incident, says former coach
item.description: The US Open normally marks the end of the grand slam season. But the coronavirus pandemic changed that and having another major just around the corner could be exactly what Novak Djokovic needs to overcome the lowest point of his career.

item.title: Hear from Australian journalists after evacuation from China
item.description: Two Australian journalists working in China have left the country after they were questioned by police and forced to seek the protection of their country's government, their news organizations said.

item.title: Oil prices are collapsing after Saudi Arabia sends ominous signal
item.description: Demand fears are once again rippling through the oil patch.

item.title: A Black man was detained while jogging for fitting a suspect description and later offered a job with the sheriff's department
item.description: A Black man jogging in the predominantly white neighborhood of Deltona, Florida, last month found himself handcuffed and detained when police said he matched the description of a suspect in a nearby burglary.

item.title: SoftBank takes $10 billion hit after being unmasked as Nasdaq 'whale'
item.description: Shares in SoftBank retreated again on Tuesday, bringing losses in Japan to 7.7% over two days following reports that the conglomerate had been making huge and risky bets on tech stocks.

item.title: Finalizing their divorce from Britain, Harry and Meghan repay $3 million spent on renovating their UK home
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have repaid the $3 million of public money that they used to renovate their home in the UK.

item.title: Blake family's attorney describes visit with Kamala Harris
item.description: B'Ivory LaMarr, attorney for the Blake family, tells CNN's Wolf Blitzer about Democratic vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris' visit with the Blake family.

item.title: Protests erupt over ad that labeled Black hair 'frizzy and dull' and blonde hair 'normal'
item.description: Two advertisements, one showing a black woman's hair labeling it "frizzy and dull," the other showing blonde hair, labeling it, "fine and flat" and "normal" set off protests at one of South Africa's largest retail pharmacies.

item.title: White supremacy is 'most lethal threat' to the US, DHS draft assessment says
item.description: White supremacists will remain the most "persistent and lethal threat" in the United States through 2021, according to Department of Homeland Security draft documents.

item.title: There's something very unique about the 2020 map
item.description: The 2020 Presidential election is one of most open fields with more swing states than we've seen in any recent election. Chris Cillizza explains why this is and how Trump and Biden are fighting to claim those states.

item.title: Bottled water company founder is China's third-richest man after another blockbuster Hong Kong IPO
item.description: A Chinese beverage giant just went public in Hong Kong with a bang, another sign of the shifting financial fortunes of the city as Beijing tightens its grip.

item.title: Father captures dramatic wildfire rescue during camping trip
item.description: The California Creek Fire suddenly engulfed the camp site where Jeremy Remington and his family were staying, leading to a helicopter rescue he caught on camera.

item.title: Director survives machete attack to bring film to Venice
item.description: Last December, filmmaker Philippe LacÃ´te experienced a brutal case of life imitating art; just as he was finishing work on a movie about a young gang leader, he was assaulted by a youth gang armed with a machete.

item.title: CNN anchor: This sums up virtual learning woes perfectly
item.description: Comedian and "One Funny Mother" personality Dena Blizzard's new video, according to CNN's Dana Bash, perfectly sums up the struggles parents are going through with their kids' virtual learning in a pandemic.

item.title: The huge rail tunnel that will change Europe
item.description: Thousands of feet beneath the Swiss Alps, a massive engineering project years in the making is reaching its final stages after a huge new tunnel was opened.

item.title: Why is this Mercedes considered a piece of art?
item.description: Artistic director of Louis Vuitton menswear Virgil Abloh has unveiled his newest project: a spin on a classic Mercedes-Benz, reimagining the company's G-Class as a streamlined racing car.

item.title: The world's largest digital camera could unlock mysteries of the universe
item.description: The world's largest digital camera can spot a golf ball from 15 miles away.

item.title: A photographer vowed to take one portrait a day for a year. This is what happened
item.description: Seductive pops of red and silvery blue appear in Zhong Lin's portraits of striking women. The self-taught Malaysian photographer, who aims to capture moments of transition in her bold and highly stylized photographs, has spent the past four months shooting a personal new series in Taiwan.

item.title: How ballet dancers train during a lockdown
item.description: Royal Ballet dancers Vadim Muntagirov, Anna Rose O'Sullivan and Melissa Hamilton show how they are training at home under lockdown.

item.title: Cat owners fall in one of five categories, researchers say. Which one are you?
item.description: If you have a cat, you may fall in one of five categories ranging from "conscientious caretaker" to "tolerant guardian," according to researchers at the University of Exeter in England.

item.title: Peloton cuts the price of its most popular bike by 15%
item.description: Peloton is cutting the price of its original at-home exercise bike by 15% and unveiling new fitness products, a sign that the company believes the pandemic has permanently changed people's workout routines and that it can further grow its fervent fan base.

item.title: Microsoft just announced a smaller, cheaper Xbox
item.description: Next-generation gaming just got smaller. Microsoft unveiled a new, cheaper Xbox that the company says will be its smallest one ever.

item.title: The 'greatest all-sport athlete' who helped revolutionize women's golf
item.description: In Beaumont, Texas, there is a small museum dedicated to a female double Olympic gold medalist and one of the greatest women golfers of all time.

item.title: The film camp giving disabled talent a chance to shine
item.description: For those with disabilities, finding a place in the film industry can feel isolating. The dearth of opportunity for disabled talent inspired the Halby family to create Zeno Mountain Farm, a camp dedicated to finding and celebrating the talent in everyone. Every summer, the camp creates a movie using an integrated cast and crew of those with and without disabilities. This year, they're taking on their most ambitious project yet: a high school musical. At Zeno, everyone deserves an equal shot at the spotlight.

item.title: Teyana Taylor gives birth in her bathroom again
item.description: Teyana Taylor and husband Iman Shumpert have welcomed a second child born in their bathroom without the assistance of a hospital.

item.title: Colonizing Mars could be dangerous and ridiculously expensive. Elon Musk wants to do it anyway
item.description: Elon Musk has spent nearly two decades rallying SpaceX fans around his goal of colonizing Mars, something world governments aren't currently attempting â€” in part because of the unfathomable price tag such a mission will entail.

item.title: The vanishing sandbars of the Philippines
item.description: During the interview round of the 1994 Miss Universe Pageant, the presenter quizzed former Miss Philippines, Charlene Gonzales, about her home country's geography.

item.title: People who have talked with the US President say he's fearful the allegations could hurt his reelection chances
item.description: President Donald Trump was visibly distressed this weekend over the fallout that ensued from the story published in The Atlantic alleging that he privately disparaged the war dead.

item.title: Analysis: The most absurd lines from Trump's 'news conference'
item.description: President Donald Trump held a news conference gave a speech on Labor Day, a grievance-and-falsehood-filled address that was more fitting for a campaign rally than the White House.

item.title: Analysis: Why Trump's dishonesty might actually matter in 2020
item.description: It's beyond debate that Donald Trump has stretched -- and broken -- the truth in ways no past president even contemplated.

item.title: Analysis: Biden is pressing a two-front war against Trump
item.description: Joe Biden has described himself as a "bridge" between the Democrats' current and future generations of leaders. But he may also be a bridge between its present and future on the electoral map.

item.title: Opinion: The three writers who could cost Trump the election
item.description: From Jeffrey Goldberg's Atlantic article, which alleges that President Donald Trump referred to soldiers who died in battle as "suckers" and "losers" -- a claim Trump denies -- to Michael Cohen's book that paints the President as a bigot, a liar and a fraud, the avalanche of negative news for the President is coming at the worst possible time for him: less than 60 days before Election Day.

item.title: CNN analyst calls out Trump's 'foul mood'
item.description: CNN's Brooke Baldwin, Gloria Borger, Abby Phillip and Jim Acosta fact check President Trump's Labor Day news conference.

item.title: India lacks social distancing as many fear worst yet to come
item.description: India has surpassed Brazil to become the nation with the second highest number of coronavirus cases after the United States. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.
